msContents.summary: The text is an acknowledgement by Hermas, son of Heron, a resident of Arsinoe, that he has accepted as a deposit from Patron, son of Ptolemaios, the sum of 100 drachmas. The terms of the agreement are such as are usual in instruments of deposit.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank

condition.ab: This light-brown papyrus is regularly cut at all sides. Three, possibly four horizontal folds. (TC)

handDesc.p: The text of this document is written in a small, rapid, but skilful and finely articulated hand. Scouring of the surface has removed or obscured the writing over some two centimeters up and down the right side of the sheet. The subscription, which begins in line 28, exhibits the large, heavy, awkward, poorly balanced letters characteristic of a bradeos graphon. (cf. Scriptiunculae II, pp. 640 f.). The document has been cancelled with a succession of oblique strokes drawn downward from left to right through the entire text.

div.ab: "Pachon 16.;The thirteenth year of the Emperor Caesar Trajan Hadrian Augustus, the sixteenth of Pachon, in Theadelphia in the Themistes division of the Arsinoite nome. Hermas, son of Heron, registered in the Second Goosefarm quarter, Persian of the epigone, about thirty-two years old, with a scar in the middle of the forehead, acknowledges to Patron, son of Ptolemaios, about twenty-two years old, with a scar on the right shin, that he has received from him one hundred drachmas in silver as a deposit free of all risk, which the acknowledging party will restore to Patron whenever Patron chooses without any delay or discussion. If he does not repay it as herein stipulated, let him pay immediately as penalty twice the amount of the deposit and damages in accordance with the law of deposits, Patron having the right of execution both against the acknowledging party, Hermas, and against all his property as if in consequence of a court decision. Let the agreement be valid. (2nd hd.) I, Hermas, son of Heron, have received the hundred drachmas . . . "
